argumentText:
ARGUMENT

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | lidlcl.u | |- U = ( LIdeal ` R ) |
| 2 |  | lidlsubcl.m | |- .- = ( -g ` R ) |
| 3 |  | #P_eqid | |- ( Base ` R ) = ( Base ` R ) |
| 4 | 3, 1 | #P_lidlss | |- ( I e. U -> I C_ ( Base ` R ) ) |
| 5 | 4 | #P_sselda | |- ( ( I e. U /\ X e. I ) -> X e. ( Base ` R ) ) |
| 6 | 5 | #P_ad2ant2lr | |- ( ( ( R e. Ring /\ I e. U ) /\ ( X e. I /\ Y e. I ) ) -> X e. ( Base ` R ) ) |
| 7 | 4 | #P_sselda | |- ( ( I e. U /\ Y e. I ) -> Y e. ( Base ` R ) ) |
| 8 | 7 | #P_ad2ant2l | |- ( ( ( R e. Ring /\ I e. U ) /\ ( X e. I /\ Y e. I ) ) -> Y e. ( Base ` R ) ) |
| 9 |  | #P_eqid | |- ( +g ` R ) = ( +g ` R ) |
| 10 |  | #P_eqid | |- ( invg ` R ) = ( invg ` R ) |
| 11 | 3, 9, 10, 2 | #P_grpsubval | |- ( ( X e. ( Base ` R ) /\ Y e. ( Base ` R ) ) -> ( X .- Y ) = ( X ( +g ` R ) ( ( invg ` R ) ` Y ) ) ) |
| 12 | 6, 8, 11 | #P_syl2anc | |- ( ( ( R e. Ring /\ I e. U ) /\ ( X e. I /\ Y e. I ) ) -> ( X .- Y ) = ( X ( +g ` R ) ( ( invg ` R ) ` Y ) ) ) |
| 13 |  | #P_simpl | |- ( ( ( R e. Ring /\ I e. U ) /\ ( X e. I /\ Y e. I ) ) -> ( R e. Ring /\ I e. U ) ) |
| 14 |  | #P_simprl | |- ( ( ( R e. Ring /\ I e. U ) /\ ( X e. I /\ Y e. I ) ) -> X e. I ) |
| 15 |  | #P_simpll | |- ( ( ( R e. Ring /\ I e. U ) /\ ( X e. I /\ Y e. I ) ) -> R e. Ring ) |
| 16 |  | #P_simplr | |- ( ( ( R e. Ring /\ I e. U ) /\ ( X e. I /\ Y e. I ) ) -> I e. U ) |
| 17 |  | #P_simprr | |- ( ( ( R e. Ring /\ I e. U ) /\ ( X e. I /\ Y e. I ) ) -> Y e. I ) |
| 18 | 1, 10 | #P_lidlnegcl | |- ( ( R e. Ring /\ I e. U /\ Y e. I ) -> ( ( invg ` R ) ` Y ) e. I ) |
| 19 | 15, 16, 17, 18 | #P_syl3anc | |- ( ( ( R e. Ring /\ I e. U ) /\ ( X e. I /\ Y e. I ) ) -> ( ( invg ` R ) ` Y ) e. I ) |
| 20 | 1, 9 | #P_lidlacl | |- ( ( ( R e. Ring /\ I e. U ) /\ ( X e. I /\ ( ( invg ` R ) ` Y ) e. I ) ) -> ( X ( +g ` R ) ( ( invg ` R ) ` Y ) ) e. I ) |
| 21 | 13, 14, 19, 20 | #P_syl12anc | |- ( ( ( R e. Ring /\ I e. U ) /\ ( X e. I /\ Y e. I ) ) -> ( X ( +g ` R ) ( ( invg ` R ) ` Y ) ) e. I ) |
| 22 | 12, 21 | #P_eqeltrd | |- ( ( ( R e. Ring /\ I e. U ) /\ ( X e. I /\ Y e. I ) ) -> ( X .- Y ) e. I ) |
\
 An ideal is closed under subtraction.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 28-Mar-2015.)  Obsolete version of ~ lidlsubcl as of 25-Mar-2020. (New usage is discouraged.)  (Proof modification is discouraged.)
